intro: Paraboea argentea, commonly known as silver paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value is appreciated in horticulture for its unique leaf color and delicate floral display.
